comment: High proof, smooth, rich full body, wonderful

Nose - Metalic rustic musty 

Palate - Gentle heat, thick and an oily with a slightly sweet finish
Thanks Lenny! Sharing with @Zslug and my bro.

Like marriage, if you're unprepared for Stagg Jr., it's going to end in divorce. This super hot, not sweet, flavor bomb will ruin your taste buds if you dont let it air a bit and drink it over ice or in a cocktail. If prepared though, you're in for a perfect bourbon treat 🥃
Notes of caramel, hot, sugary finish.

During a recent chocolate and bourbon pairing tasting event at a local whiskey bar a question came up of who was George T. Stagg and his importance in the Buffalo Trace line of brands.
George T. Stagg served in the Civil War and received a field commission, promoting to Captain in 1863. After the war he became a successful whiskey salesman and a partner in 'Gregory & Stagg, Commercial Merchants & Distillers.'
In 1878, George T. Stagg took ownership stake in Old Fire & Copper (O.F.C.) Distillery and partnered with previous owner, Colonel E. H. Taylor Jr. That partnership soured and dissolved within the decade and resulted in Taylor's exit from the company.
George T. Stagg retired in early 1890's and passed in 1893, at a young age of 58. The distillery was renamed 'The George T. Stagg Distillery' in 1904. It was purchased by Sazerac Company in 1992 and officially renamed to Buffalo Trace Distillery in 1999. Whisky Advocate Magazine gave it Distillery of the Year honors in 2000.
Stagg Jr expression was first released in 2013.
Nose has citrus, chocolate, brown sugar, and caramel. On the palate lots of heat with charred oak and leather followed by brown sugar and caramel sweetness. Alcohol burns fades on the finish with black pepper spice and burnt brown sugar, dark chocolate, and raisins at the very end.
This bottle clocks in at 132.3 proof and is still a great consolation bottle for anyone who wants the George T. Stagg and can't get it.

Straight 🔥🔥🔥!!! Ethanol and brown sugar on the nose. The high proof hits you on the first sip. Vanilla and barrel with the smallest hint of apple spice. The finish is long and gives a nice warm Kentucky hug! Buffalo Trace has not disappointed me yet!
Very rich caramel and vanilla notes, oak, honey and burnt toffee flavors.  Surprisingly easy to drink despite the 63.95% abv.  Few drips ofnwater recommended to open it up
Rich, sweet, loads of caramel flavor, long finish

Love it. Not sure if I have come upon anything I enjoy more. Rich, sweet nose and flavor. Kinda reminds me of a baked dessert. Cherry and vanilla with some sugar and noticeable heat. Little bit of citrus. The finish goes on for days.
Initial spicy kick, with a sweet, caramel finish

12/14/19
Batch 12 - 132.3 proof

Nose:  sweet fruit with black cherry but once it sat it presented more spice 

Palate: full rich spicy with cardamom and pepper

Finish: dry long finish with more baking spice and Kentucky hug

If you like heat and baking spice add to your collection.
Sugary with cinnamon spice. Fruity on the back end with notes of smoked oak. Smoother than the proof. Like George T but younger.
Really high proof. Spicy and full. More floral with a drop of water. Somewhat smoky.

향 : 그을린 흑설탕, 말린 건과일, 체리향, 페퍼민트, 
맛 : 고도수의 스파이시, 채리마루, 아이스크림, 
피니쉬 : 흑설탕, 달콤한 스모키, 

물한방울 : 스모키 & 오키함이 확 살아남, 긴 피니쉬동안 스모키함이 느껴짐 
63.2도
Cherry, fudge, stewed Apple, caramel, so cherry forward
Vanilla, spicy notes in the beginning then a sharp burn for a finish. Great taste and aroma. Will drink again but wouldn't recommend for the beginner aficionado.

Not as good as senior, but wow!  Surprisingly sweet up front and smooth, followed with a decent amount of bite.  Seems like there is some caramel & after a couple sips I think there is some cherry as well.  If it was easier to find I could have a new go to.
Spicy oatmeal cookie with maple, quick finish

Smooth for a barrel proof, can feel the heat but no bite.  Nose picks up maple syrup and vanilla. Some sweetness in the flavor, pick up that syrup taste but yet spicy.  Thinking this will help shift my mind off of Xmas shopping, prep, meals and wrapping!  A mini vacation
It's not the most intense of most barrel proofs I've tried out there, but the price makes up for it. It still has the pleasant rich and sweet flavors of the BT products I enjoy.
very heavy on the proof.  Bringing the proof down brings out a lot of caramel and honey notes.

Batch 11 - 127.9 the first one I had out the bottle was extremely rough. Let it air for a while came back and much better. I even cut this with ice and the flavor still holds. Not as great as the father but this batch of jr is pretty nice after it sits a while.

Nose: cherry, grape syrup 
Palate: tons of spice and kick, cinnamon
Hot with the first sip with a nice sweet finish
Brown sugar and nilla on the nose. Definitely brown sugar and heat on initial taste
Big gnarly oaky aroma. Prickles the tongue like wasabi then dissipates quickly.
This batch is amazing! Cherry Bomb!

Batch 12- Absolutely phenomenal. Genuinely tastes like a slightly younger version of GTS ‘19. Wonderful flavor profile that matches the nose. Notes of chocolate, sweet oak, caramel and char. Finish is long and lush, delivering the full BP punch. Even better finding it at retail, well worth paying even double. They’ve perfected it this year. Find it, but it.
Rich, heavy with brown sugar on the front. Back-end lingers, with a more pronounced alcohol bite than some other cask strength bourbons, but well worth it.
I’m a big fan of barrel strength bourbons, and this is one of my favorites. Blast of flavor, and hot just like I like it.
Good flavor with a nice heat.

My local mom/pop liquor store here in Excelsior Springs, MO scored a case of Stagg Jr August '17. She is a nice (smart) lady. She often prices the top shelf spirits a little under the suggested retail price, so her small town customers will give them a try. I was able to get my first bottle of Stagg Jr. for $46. I have seen stores in nearby Kansas City price it as high as $100. This has to be the most impressive bourbon I have ever tried. (I have never tasted Stagg original or a Pappy.) Smooth enough at 129.5 proof to sip neat, but the flavors are even more pronounced with a few drops of water to open it up. (Drops, not a splash!) The taste and aroma of warm dark brown sugar is full forward, underlain with the sweetness of corn, jazzed with rye spice, and followed by a lingering orange zest. The finish is long and inviting.
Brown sugar and molasses on the nose and palate. Vanilla and more brown sugar on the finish. Tons of flavor. Tons of heat. This was Batch 12 at 132 Proof and it’s worth seeking out.

N - heavy cherry like cherry syrup a little vanilla some alcohol

P - definite heat and cherry sweetness from the nose.  Tastes and feels rich but can't quite pick the flavors out.

F - long heat and spice with oak lasting the longest.

Not an every day sipper for me need to be in the right mood for rich heat.
Really, really hot. Has a long full bodied finish. Somewhat spicy, not very sweet. Some oak or smoke to it. Quite good! Gets better as I drink.
Delicious! It’s a bit hot, but full of sweet and oaky flavors. I’ll grab it whenever I see it for sure.
This is awesome. Strong, sweet flavorful. Keep this in hand

Nose: I got a lot of sweeter notes, like sugar cookies along with fresh fruits. I also got some warm along spices like cinnamon or nutmeg. 

Taste: I mean where do I start. Immediately I am hit with snickerdoodle cookies, where the brown sugar and cinnamon come through but that quickly transitions into a darker sweetness like maple syrup, all while having that warm spice to it. For a bourbon with this high of proof, I thought it was so smooth. Eventually add a little bit of water to it and it brings out so many more tastes. 
LOVE this stuff.
Love it. It’s super stout burn from the high proof but my favorite buttery mouth feel followed by a Carmel finish. Better with a tiny bit of water to cut it.

Nose - a lot of spices and fruit on the nose. Very pleasant
Palate - very solid leather and oak taste. Very nice spice level. Overall great quality bourbon taste that’s easy to drink 
Finish - very strong feel but easy going down. Very nice

Not my cup of tea. A lot of heat, but didn’t comfort me well.

Smells like brown sugar. 

Add a drop of water and it makes it better.

The nose is sweeter than expect, but you can still s the burn.

Hot on the tongue, like a cinnamon roll, but sweet enough to taste the icing.

The heat was a little overpowering for me
As hot as it is, it is one of my favorites.  Coconut,  spices, orange, caramel, and oak. For the money, not sure there's anything better.

After the Old Carter and Woodford Batch Proof, this didn't stand a chance, though it's bite was mellowed out because of my previous tastes

(Drug City Tasting Room)
Has a mind for victory and an arm like a fucking cannon.

I have enjoyed this neat at home and neat in a couple restaurants and the same flavor overwhelmed me each time. Strong grains - almost frosted flakes or raisin bran with that alcohol punch of the high proof. Consistently one of my favorites and always a go-to if on a menu

3/29/2020 revision - tried back to back with booker’s (kentucky chew). all top end sweet. the kentucky chew provided a richness & palate depth the stagg couldn’t match. lowering rating to 4. 


original review - batch 12 - wow. holy crap with the sweetness. 132 proof? doesn’t even feel it with all that flavor coming through. much too easy to drink & enjoy. will be interesting to try with a good meal to see how the flavor will level out

Batch 12. Nice rich deep color. Good legs. On the nose in a Glen Cairne this is a rich sweet dried cherry bomb. Vanilla honey and leather. On the pallet dried dark rich fruit. Dark Cherry, baking spice and leather . Oily and sweet.

It is pleasantly sweet with just enough spice to balance it out and not let it be nothing but sweetness, so to speak. Less flavors of vanilla and more flavors of chocolate and fruits. I'm someone who doesn't like heavy spice, and even at the high proof it is I can drink this straight without water. Literally only a couple drops of water if I do add any, this does open up the chocolate sweetness more. This bourbon is in my opinion superior to Blanton SB. If you can find It, BUY IT!
Batch 12 - Smooth and balanced heat from start to finish
Pretty hot at first taste, mellows out as you drink it. Notes of vanilla and warm spices.
The tasting note is spot on..
Real concentrated (flavor and alcohol). Have to ease into this one.

Batch 10 126.4 proof. Dove in without nosing, wave of melted butter (not butter scotch) over the tongue. Developed into oranges and cinnamon. Familiar maple syrup before the burn. Excellent long finish with spice, eucalyptus, and a little camphor.
Hoppy Endings with Naco and Lauren. Glad to finally have this
Excellent smell of vanilla, oak, and cinnamon. Taste is similar with a very nice finish. Great bourbon if you can find it!

The burn is definitely there but not bad for a barrel proof bourbon. 
Nice sweetness of brown sugar and molasses. Smoke comes through in the end as well.
Depends on the batch. Runs a bit hot
Bold and flavorful with leather smells

Batch 13. Nose is cherry cola, vanilla, caramel, tobacco, oak. Flavor bomb! Spice and heat. The hellfire burn lingers in the back of your throat and chest. Good stuff. Will add a few drops of water to the next glass to see how it opens up.
Consistently one of my go to’s. If I only could have one bottle - this is it. It may not be for everyone but it hits all of my taste buds just right

Another excellent barrel proof.

Oak spice and mild vanilla on the nose. The taste has hot chili pepper and oak up front that quickly turns into sweet caramel and a thick cherry syrup. The sweetness builds on the finish while my mouth continued to dry out.
Light spice and caramel nose. Light in the mouth. Brown sugar, and tannins blend nicely. Surprisingly smooth for a barrel proof.
My first barrel proof taste.  Very strong but it was great once I got past the first taste
Hotter on the backend with a satisfying lasting taste. Flavor opened up with very little water. Easy to drink neat considering 134 proof.

Neat.  Batch 12.  Time to see what the hype is about.  Strong nose.  Cola and leather.  Oak and burnt caramel.  A surprisingly bright vanilla and apple. Brown sugar and cinnamon.  More oak.  This has a more complex nose than any Stagg Jr I can recall.  As you pick it apart you can find almost every note, high notes, low notes, mid notes.  All delicious.

Viscous on the tongue and man that is a Stagg punch to the face.  My mouth is numb. Took a step back for a bit and let myself get acclimated.  It’s a flavor bomb every step of the way.  Burnt caramels, cherry, vanilla and oak all dialed to 11 and linger forever.  Dries the mouth out which leads to legs coming back for another wave as your mouth attempts to fight back.  Got some nuttiness on this last sip.  Dry roasted peanuts.

I understand the hype.  This is everything you want Stagg Jr. to be.  Classic bourbon flavors dialed up and relentlessly punching you in the face.  Reminds me more of a EHT Barrel Proof than prior Stagg Jr. batches (which I also loved.). Sadly this is so good it will just make Stagg Jr. harder to find.

Batch 13 review. Thick cherry and vanilla on the nose. Robust, full bodied, oily coating. This thing just fills the senses with a great long finish with a mild burn that’s more of a warming sensation. Although different BT mash bills, I compared this to some of my open bottles which include WLW17, Blantons SFTB, Blantons Gold, HMcKenna10 (not BT), and Weller 12. I would rate it at StaggJr, WLW17, BSFTB, McKenna, Weller 12, BGold. It’s that good to me.
The nose shouts vanilla!!! Very pleasurable to the palate with hints of floral, vanilla a tinge of oil finished with spice. I will buy this again

Nose is dominated by barrel char.  Very hot.  Some rye comes through as well as notes of dark caramel and hints of cigar smoke and rye.
Very hot from the palate down through the finish.  A splash of water opens it up a bit and reveals notes of dark cherry and black pepper.  Dries a bit at the back and shows the wood.

2019, likely batch 12 while out and about.  Rich amber color, many slim legs.

The nose is like a vanilla caramel Sunday with elements of oak, tobacco and ethanol.  The first sip is so deceiving - velvety and smooth.  Then like a naturally aspirated flat 6 or v8 it builds, and builds.  The burn whales toward the end as you breathe fumes.

The palate is hands down amazing though.  Rich, complex, etc but for me it was almost like drinking a Mexican fried ice cream.  Vanilla, maple, cream/butter with cinnamon and cherry toward the finish.

This is my end of times bourbon, one for gunslingers and heroes.

Nose: vanilla and caramel
Palate: oily but very spicy
Finish: very spicy and long

The now famous, Batch 12.  132.3 proof. 

Nose is powerful and infinitely complex; molasses, maple, brown sugar, black cherry, plum, barrel char, chocolate, cinnamon, leather, pipe tobacco, and dark oak almost mahogany. Yes, all that is really in there and in equal strengths. 

On the palate, just literally look at the components listed above in the aroma because they are all present on the tongue as well. This bourbon encompasses all that is "dark"; dark fruits, dark sugars, and dark wood. Flavors are rich and blend seamlessly. A splash of water to take it down a few proof points and this one genuinely sings.

Finish literally goes on forever. Longest I have ever had by far. I hate to sound like a broken record, but everything in the nose/palate is also there in the finish before it finally subsides leaving you with some tingly menthol and chili pepper. Mouthfeel is thick and chewy. Kentucky hug is real even after the addition of water. 

Overall just a transcendent bourbon. And when you figure in the price? If there's anything out there that beats this for $60, I'd love to taste it. Will always attempt to have this on the shelf. If you find it and you have never had it, buy it. Case closed.
Oak and vanilla. Viscous, oily mouthfeel.
Some burn on the tongue but very smooth for a barrel proof whiskey.

Phenomenal whiskey. 

Nose: ethanol first due to the proof. After a few minutes, I smelled strong maple and brown sugar. Unique sweetness and complexity. Only nose I’ve had that even compares to this is pappy 15.

Taste: very rich, smooth, viscous. Velvety oak notes with a little bit of chocolate. Based on the flavor and smoothness, I would have never guessed the proof. Very little bite. 

Lingering finish, but it’s not as long as I expected given the proof. The taste and finish were both also sweeter than I expected. 

If you can somehow find this bottle, it’s worth it to me. One of my favorites I’ve ever had the chance to try. I get all BT are hyped up, but this one lives up to it in my opinion.

Batch 12.  Just phenomenal!  It's still damn hot, but so packed full of flavors with a thick, viscous mouthfeel.  Tasting notes are spot on.  Brown sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, oak, cherry.  About as close to GTS as you can get.
Smooth and sweet up front with a buttery mouth feel. A touch of fire and you feel the alcohol in the finish
Heat, but fairly smooth for the proof. Brown sugar and maple at first and finish.
Fruity but a strong finish.  Very strong.

Not generally a bourbon drinker, pretty decent. Brown sugar, cherry and barrel spice on the nose, punches you in the face with vanilla, molasses/dark caramel, and some background dark chocolate and coffee on the taste. Finish is alcohol bite, giving way to smooth wide vanilla sweetness, and a bit of tannic bitterness from the barrel.
Just wish it lasted longer on the palette, but really great bourbon that instantly spreads across your tongue.
Damn damn good. Vanilla notes and a burn but not like a rye. Awesome

The best high proof bourbon I have in my collection, I randomly saw this at my local store mixed in with the regular stuff...owner was sneaky and didn't put it on his rare shelf, but I saw it and jumped! The Jr is misleading as this is still rocket fuel, but tasting blind with other barrels like Elijah, bulleit frontier and rare breed this is the clear winner

I enjoyed this one. Very strong. Opened up nice with 1 small ice cube. Drinking this neat would burn too much for me. If you see it give it a try. Wouldn't seek this one out again though. There's more to life than chasing wheat whiskey and Buffalo Trace products.

STAGG JR (Spring 2016/132.5 proof)
 
APPEARANCE: Dark Copper. Oily Coating of Glencairn with fat slow moving droplets.
NOSE: Dry & Dusty. Cocoa Powder, Wet Coffee Grounds, Toffee, Hay, Leather, Old Oak. After time some Dried Peach/Apricot. Not as much heat as expected. Very Nice.
NEAT: Buttery, Coating mouthfeel. Varnished Oak on tip of tongue. Then Hay, Unlit Cigar, and Salted Caramel. A Floral Taste? Lots of Astringent Oak mid to back of palate. A Loooong Drying, Warming finish with a deep in the chest Kentucky Hug. Dark Chocolate, Black Pepper, and Drying Bitter Oak coats the palate. That astringency builds with each sip. 
SPLASH: After a couple additions of spring water, the nose becomes all Citrus and Floral. Helps with the astringency, but doesn't eliminate it. The palate gets Honey Butter and more Traditional Oak notes. Adds a little Spearmint to the finish.

VERDICT: There is no Batch Number listed on the bottle, but it was purchased in August of 2016 (As a sign of how times have changed, I had passed on previous opportunities to purchase this because of its $45 price tag). While doing my #SocialDistancing I've been reaching into the back of the cabinet for some forgotten gems. I sampled about 1/4 of the bottle back in late 2016 and found it to be overly astringent. No matter how much water was added, I could not get the offending astringency to go away. I liked it enough to give it a 4 despite that quibble. Time open hasn't removed the astringent note, but it has tamed is some if my memory serves. The nose is outstanding, and while the palate does still suffer from some bitterness, this is still one of the better bottles in my collection. 4.25
Taste a lot like the rest of the Buffalo Trace line.
Heat and sweet. Leaves the mouth buzzing in the best way
Beautiful, complex bourbon. Really opens up with a splash of water. Lovely cinnamon notes.

Nose: Notes of vanilla and cherry. 
Taste: vanilla, tea and cherry. 
Finish: long vanilla dry note. Long hug
Really sweet smell. Sweet flavor, proofing is noticeable only on first sip but afterwards is just smooth. This is great whiskey.

The nose is very deceptive...light and easy.   Then BAM!  The palate blows you away.   First,  heat then cinnamon (think Red Hots).   Prepare yourself for a very long,  enjoyable finish.   The longest of any bourbons.

Keeping things very simple, this tastes like an amped up Eagle Rare. It's like someone perfectly seasoned an already delicious steak. It also drank well below its proof - though it was likely opened for at least a few weeks.
Needs some water to open it up
Golf and D&D with @Zslug and @jdjmad and @Kyle-Metes-Randolph!
Had this on a family vacation while in the Bahamas...kept coming back every night for it!

The legs in this barrel proof bourbon are super thin and viscous to the point of immobile. It’s also a dark amber color.

The nose is sweet and rich. Brown sugar, snickerdoodle cookie, cinnamon, vanilla, red apple, cherry candy, popcorn all tease the nose.

The palate is spicy and sweet. cinnamon, cardamom, burnt caramel, and the chocolate oranges you find at Christmastime all tickle the tastebuds.

The finish is hot, long, and ashy. Cheers!
Sunburned my arms and legs earlier, now whiskey burning my insides with John Wick 3.

Very sweet, cinnamon and hot on the nose

Palate: vanilla and brown sugar followed by woody cinnamon and then HEAT. 

Nice warm long finish.
Wishing I was having a cigar and some Stagg Jr. with my friend @magicalpoet
Big brown sugar nose. Rich, thick, and sweet molasses on the palate. Strong finish with a bit of kick.
